summary: "The Marshall Mathers LP" is Eminem's third album, released in 2000. It was produced by Dr. Dre and others, and featured artists like Dido and Snoop Dogg. The album talks about Eminem's life, fame, and family problems. It had controversial lyrics but was still very popular. It had three hit singles and won a Grammy for Best Rap Album. The album sold very well, over 25 million copies worldwide, and is considered Eminem's best work. A sequel was released in 2013.
title: The Marshall Mathers LP
